engine_status: V2 CYCLE 3 COMPLETE -- DEEPENING & CORRECTION CYCLE. Real data replaces estimates across manufacturing, food production, SBA 504, competitive density. 38 signals scanned. 10 counter-signals produced (2+ per Tier 1). KEY CORRECTIONS: Legal AI score DOWN (Lawhive $60M competitor). Insurance AI score DOWN (4% scaling rate). Manufacturing acquisition CONFIRMED with real BizBuySell data and capital stack modeling. Healthcare admin REFRAMED (provider-side, not payer-side). Accounting full-service layer identified as true gap.

business_models.name: AI-First Full-Service SMB Bookkeeping (NOT Tool Layer)
business_models.target: 23M US single-entity small businesses without CPA
business_models.unit_economics: Inference cost ~$0.05/month per client. Support/compliance ~$10/client/month. Target margin 60-70% at $199/month price point. CAC estimate: $200-500 for unserved SMBs (lower friction than switching).

business_models.name: Fractional AI CFO for Growth SMBs
AI Tax for US-LATAM Cross-Border

tier_1.key_signals: O*NET: Bookkeepers 85-90% routine-cognitive (highest automation potential). 75% CPAs retiring. 70% SMBs unserved. Tool layer crowded (Puzzle, Zeni, Vic.ai + embedded in Xero/Intuit) but SERVICE layer sparse (Basis, Docyt emerging). FULL-SERVICE layer EMPTY. AI accounting market $10.87B growing 44.6% CAGR. Only 16% operationally deployed. Counter-signals: works for simple cases only, trust/integration barriers real, embedded AI threatens tools.
tier_1.cycle_3_updates: CORRECTED: Score -1 from cycle 2. Service layer no longer empty (Basis, Docyt building). But FULL-SERVICE layer (AI does the work, not helps) remains empty for simple SMBs. Embedded AI in Xero/Intuit threatens tool layer -- validates service/full-service focus. Unit economics modeled: $0.05/month inference per client, effective cost advantage 10-50x. Target single-entity unserved SMBs first (lower complexity, lower trust barrier). Counter-signal: AI bookkeeping only works for simple cases -- but that IS the 23M unserved market.
barriers: CPA licensing (moat -- CA AB 1175 easing Jan 2027)
Embedded AI in Xero/Intuit threatens tool layer (validates service focus)
Trust deficit for financial data (target unserved first)
moats: Data flywheel from serving unserved SMBs
next_steps: Build AI-first full-service bookkeeping for single-entity SMBs
Price at $149-199/month (below Zeni $549 but above DIY)
Acquire/partner 1-2 small CPA practices in CA for licensing
Target unserved 23M SMBs (no switching friction)
Spanish version for LATAM expansion

business_models.name: AI Healthcare Admin for Independent Practices (Provider-Side)
Provider-Side Prior Auth AI (Counter to WISeR Payer AI)
business_models.target: Practices in WISeR states needing to navigate AI-powered prior auth

business_models.name: Horizontal AI Business-in-a-Box for Independent Practices

tier_1.key_signals: O*NET: Medical Records 97% automation probability (highest). CMS WISeR vendors identified (Cohere, Genzeon, Humata, Innovaccer, Virtix, Zyter). BUT WISeR vendor selection CLOSED. Congressional repeal bill introduced. AMA: 61% say AI increases denials. Competitors hyper-specialized (HealthSpark PT, Verse SLP). No HORIZONTAL platform for all 600K+ practices. Provider-side AI to fight payer AI = arms race dynamic.
tier_1.cycle_3_updates: CORRECTED: Score -2 from cycle 2. WISeR vendor selection is CLOSED -- cannot enter as vendor. Political risk real (congressional repeal bill). REFRAMED: payer-side opportunity weakened, but PROVIDER-SIDE opportunity STRENGTHENED. Practices need AI to navigate the new WISeR world (fight denials, optimize submissions). Competitors are hyper-specialized by practice type -- horizontal platform across ALL practice types is the gap. 97% automation rate for medical records = deepest Baumol Cure.
barriers: Physician opposition to AI in care decisions
next_steps: Start with provider-side: help practices fight AI-powered denials
Build horizontal platform (not hyper-specialized by practice type)
Pilot in WISeR states where practices face new prior auth burden
Use HIPAA-compliant platforms (Hathr.ai / OpenAI) to reduce infra cost

tier_1.structural_shift: Robotics x AI Manufacturing Acquisition & Modernization (CONFIRMED WITH REAL DATA)

business_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize: CNC Machine Shop (Specific Target Profile)
business_models.target: Retirement-sale CNC/fabrication shops in CA ($1-3M revenue, $300-400K EBITDA)
business_models.capital_structure: SBA 504 $1.2M (5.85%, 25yr, fees waived) + Bank $1.5M (7%, 10yr) + Equipment financing $400K (8%, 5yr, 80% LTV) + Equity $550K
business_models.unit_economics: Monthly debt service ~$18K. Pre-modernization EBITDA $29K/mo (covers debt from day 1). Post-modernization: $163-195K/yr additional savings from 25-30% COGS reduction. 5-station cobot modernization: $225-550K. ROI 8-14 months on robotics investment.
business_models.production_fit: STRONG -- custom fabrication, precision parts, variable products

business_models.name: Manufacturing AI Integration Service
business_models.target: SME manufacturers needing help deploying AI/robotics

tier_1.key_signals: REAL DATA: 379 CA manufacturing businesses for sale (BizBuySell). Median asking $600K. CNC shops: $1.25M-$3M asking, $1-2M revenue, $300-400K EBITDA. SBA 504 actual rates 5.67-5.91% (Feb 2026), fees waived through Sept 2026 for manufacturers. First-time buyers need 15% down (CORRECTION). Equipment financing 6-15%, 80-100% LTV for cobots/CNC. Cobot pricing: UR5 $50K, FANUC CRX-5iA $43K. Counter-signals: 70% M&A fail synergies, tariff uncertainty, 12-18 month realistic integration timeline.
tier_1.cycle_3_updates: CONFIRMED AND STRENGTHENED: Score +1 from cycle 2. Real BizBuySell data CONFIRMS acquisition thesis at accessible prices. Capital stack MODELED with actual terms (debt service covered from day 1 by existing EBITDA). CORRECTION: first-time buyers need 15% down (not 10%). Counter-signals add realism: 70% M&A failure rate means operational capability is critical. Tariff risk exists but fewer competing buyers = favorable acquisition environment. Realistic integration timeline 12-18 months, not 3-6.
barriers: 70% M&A synergy failure rate (operational capability is key)
next_steps: Screen specific BizBuySell CNC/fabrication listings in CA with $1-3M revenue
Establish CDC relationship for SBA 504 (Statewide CDC for fast processing)
Identify cobot integration partners (UR/FANUC distributors in CA)
Build due diligence framework for manufacturing acquisitions
Timeline: begin screening now, target acquisition by Q3 2026 (before SBA fee waiver expires Sept 30)

tier_1.structural_shift: Specialty Food/Beverage Production AI + Robotics (CONFIRMED WITH REAL TARGETS)

business_models.name: Acquire-and-Modernize: Specialty Food Producer (Wholesale Bakery Profile)
business_models.unit_economics: Wholesale bakery: $1.7M revenue, $500K profit, 14 employees. Acquire at $1-1.5M. Add 2-3 cobots ($100-180K) + AI scheduling/QC ($50-100K). Automate 4-5 positions ($160-200K/yr savings). Increase throughput 30-50%. New margin 35-45%.
business_models.production_fit: BEST FIT -- variable products, quality-sensitive, high labor %, strong brand differentiation

business_models.name: AI-Powered Craft Food Production Platform

tier_1.key_signals: REAL LISTINGS: 77 CA food production businesses for sale. Wholesale bakery $1.7M revenue/$500K profit. Bottling facility available. Specialty charcuterie, artisanal sausage, Mexican snacks operations. USDA VAPG $250K (corrected from $200K), highly competitive. SBA 504 fee waiver for manufacturers. Counter-signals: FDA/USDA certification transfer, seasonal demand, food safety compliance.
tier_1.cycle_3_updates: PROMOTED from Tier 2 to Tier 1 (score +2). Real BizBuySell listings CONFIRM viable targets at accessible prices. Specific unit economics modeled for wholesale bakery acquisition. USDA VAPG corrected to $250K max. Food production is BEST FIT for robotics x AI (variable products, quality-sensitive, high labor %). Capital stack (SBA 504 + VAPG + equipment financing) creates structural advantage unavailable to digital businesses.
barriers: FDA/USDA certification transfer (strong moat once achieved)
next_steps: Screen specific BizBuySell food production listings in CA
Prioritize wholesale bakery or specialty producer with existing distribution
Model USDA VAPG + SBA 504 capital stack for specific target
Identify cobot packaging + AI QC integration partners
Research Davis CA local food production ecosystem

tier_1.structural_shift: Insurance Claims AI -- SMB/TPA Layer (ADJUSTED DOWN)

business_models.name: AI Claims Processing for TPAs and Mid-Market Insurers
AI Claims for LATAM Insurance Market

tier_1.key_signals: 78% P&C insurers adopted GenAI but only 4% SCALED. Manual error rates 7-12%. AI needs >95% accuracy. 88% customer concern about human oversight. Microsoft + Cognizant deploying enterprise solutions. Total AI claims startup funding still <$20M. Counter-signals: hallucination risk, 70% customer mistrust, 4% scaling rate = implementation harder than expected, regulatory uncertainty.
tier_1.cycle_3_updates: CORRECTED: Score -3 from cycle 2. The 4% vs 78% scaling gap is a REAL signal that implementation is much harder than assumed. Customer mistrust at 70% = slow adoption. Hallucination liability risk is specific and material. Enterprise adoption via Microsoft/Cognizant may squeeze the market from above. HOWEVER: SMB/TPA layer remains underserved -- 1,200+ TPAs need AI-as-a-service that enterprise solutions don't serve. Opportunity is real but SLOWER than cycle 2 scoring implied.
moats: First-mover on NAIC AI model law
next_steps: Focus on auto/property claims (simpler, lower stakes)
Build for >95% accuracy with human-in-the-loop for complex cases
5-state compliance first
LATAM version for cross-border expansion

tier_2.structural_shift: AI-First Legal Services -- SMB Corporate Niche (NARROWED)

business_models.name: AI-First Corporate Legal for SMBs (Contracts, Employment, IP)
AI Legal Platform for Solo/Small Firms

tier_2.key_signals: Lawhive $60M Series B, $35M ARR, 7x growth, 35 US states. Garfield AI SRA-regulated. August $375/mo for small firms. Paralex hybrid for flat-fee SMB. 37% SMBs already using AI for legal. Counter-signals: Lawhive direct competitor at service layer, UPL enforcement tightening, bar licensing hard barrier.
tier_2.cycle_3_updates: DEMOTED from Tier 1 to Tier 2 (score -7). Lawhive's $60M Series B (Feb 5, 2026) is a GAME-CHANGER. They are building at the service layer for consumer/SMB legal with $35M ARR and 7x growth. The service layer gap identified in cycle 2 is CLOSING RAPIDLY. The remaining niche is SMB CORPORATE legal specifically (contracts, employment, IP) -- Lawhive focuses on consumer. Score adjustment reflects dramatically increased competition.
barriers: 37% SMB adoption already (market more mature than assumed)
next_steps: Narrow focus to SMB corporate legal (contracts, employment, compliance)
Monitor Lawhive US expansion closely
CA bar licensing pathway exploration

tier_2.structural_shift: PE Distress Cascade -- Fewer Competing Buyers (UPDATED)

business_models.name: Distressed Professional Services/Manufacturing Acquirer
AI-First Staffing Platform (PE distressed)

tier_2.key_signals: Chapter 11 at decade high. PE-backed 30% of filings. Distress rate +148%. Tariff uncertainty scaring PE away from manufacturing M&A = fewer competing buyers at small-business level. Quality of transactions improving. M&A volume below expectations.
tier_2.cycle_3_updates: Score -1. Macro headwinds (tariffs, rates) create an interesting paradox: they suppress PE activity (fewer competing buyers) while maintaining distress levels (more available targets). The acquisition environment may actually be FAVORABLE for a non-PE acquirer with operational capability. But integration risk remains the primary concern (70% M&A synergy failure rate).
next_steps: Map distressed firms in CA (both services and manufacturing)
Build broker relationships for deal flow
Focus on retirement sales (less complexity than distressed/bankruptcy)

tier_2.structural_shift: Precision Agriculture AI + Robotics -- Davis CA Advantage (BEAR CASE ACKNOWLEDGED)

business_models.name: AI-Powered Specialty Crop Service (Davis CA)
Autonomous Farm Equipment Service

tier_2.key_signals: Precision ag commercial in 2026. 15-30% input cost reduction. Davis CA epicenter. But: seasonal revenue, weather dependence, John Deere/CNH/AGCO spending billions. Farmer adoption slow. Specialty crops (almonds, grapes, tomatoes) = niche where OEMs underserve.
tier_2.cycle_3_updates: Score -3. Counter-signals are substantive: OEM competition (Deere See & Spray already commercial), seasonal revenue, capital intensity. The specialty crop niche remains valid but OEM threat is the biggest risk. Davis CA location advantage is real but may not be sufficient against billion-dollar R&D budgets. This is a LONGER timeline opportunity than manufacturing acquisition.
barriers: John Deere/CNH/AGCO OEM competition (billions in R&D)
next_steps: Focus narrowly on specialty crops (almonds, grapes, tomatoes) where OEMs underserve
UC Davis partnership exploration
Prototype drone + AI monitoring for 2-3 pilot farms

v1_vs_v2_comparison.v2_cycle_3: 3 cycles, 5 Tier 1 (Food promoted, Legal demoted), 5 Tier 2, 6 Tier 3 = 16 opportunities mapped, 34 business models, 10 counter-signals, 0 kills. Real data replaces estimates on manufacturing, food, SBA 504, competitive density.
v1_vs_v2_comparison.key_difference: v2-3 is a CORRECTION cycle. Scores moved both up (Food +2, Manufacturing +1) and DOWN (Legal -7, Insurance -3, Healthcare -2). Counter-signals are as rigorous as supporting signals. Real BizBuySell data, actual SBA 504 terms, specific unit economics replace estimates.
